comments.body: The Google Material variant requires the OutlineInputBorder, is this something we can make configurable?
My hope is that we can expose these kinds of things in a DatePickerTheme pass.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +236,240 @@            TextFormField(
              decoration: InputDecoration(
                border: const UnderlineInputBorder(),
                filled: true,
                // TODO(darrenaustin): localize 'mm/dd/yyyy' and 'Enter Date'

comments.body: Do we need a TODO here to localize the separators?

There is already one above:

```dart
                // TODO(darrenaustin): localize date separator '/'
                _DateTextInputFormatter('/'),
```

These separators in the regex are any separators that the keyboard might be supplying that we always want to just map to the locale's separator. Probably not necessary, but I was worried about a date keyboard that comes up might not have locale's separator on it. The user would still be able to use these other separator keys and they would map to the right one.

@darrenaustin I'm about to check in something that replaces WhitelistingTextInputFormatter and BlacklistingTextInputFormatter with a single FilteringTextInputFormatter that handles replacement even for the case of allow-list filtering, which you might be able to use here.
